channel.title: In the new client
channel.description:
By new client I mean 378+...
Anyways, you know how they have added in all of the useless parameters and extra ints and shit that isnt used except to add one to it every once and a while to make it look important. Well I was wondering if they also added in useless classes like that as well or do all of the classes have a purpose? :/

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @_doyley _doyley
item.description:
@_doyley wrote:

maybe

Read full topic

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:18, topic:182406”][quote author=Ollie link=topic=244060.msg2064952#msg2064952 date=1203451665]

some of the classes only contain static members, these are what you would call “useless”
[/quote]Uhh, uhh, uhh, not all of the all-static classes are just the children of obfuscation! I’m thinking of one class in particular, but I’ve forgotten what you named it.

DrawingArea is one, (whatever you may call it)

it call it Render[/quote]
DrawingArea isn’t obfuscated as much as the others. The only conversion in it, is the naming.
It never contains RSStrings, or silly method counters / fake arguments.
This is probably to keep it quick and less memory taking because it does most calculating.
That’s the only reason it’s not ripped apart.
Btw. it extends NodeSub, so it could never been an obfuscation child

Read full topic

it call it Render

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:14, topic:182406”][quote author=henry link=topic=244060.msg2063156#msg2063156 date=1203380577]
I meant are there any classes that are never actually called on or are pointlessly called on like how some methods are method4324(Byte byte0) and the byte is used in the method as if(byte0 == 0) {} when it is always called as method4324(0). This is a made up method btw… just an example.
[/quote]
they’re called dummy arguments, and can be cleanedup with any real refactoring.[/quote]
Yea I know… thats not my point? right there I was just trying to explain what I was comparing it too.

Read full topic

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @super_OLDACCOUNT super_OLDACCOUNT
item.description:

henry:

I meant are there any classes that are never actually called on or are pointlessly called on like how some methods are method4324(Byte byte0) and the byte is used in the method as if(byte0 == 0) {} when it is always called as method4324(0). This is a made up method btw… just an example.

they’re called dummy arguments, and can be cleanedup with any real refactoring.

Read full topic

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @BAsh_CntLgn BAsh(CntLgn)
item.description:
@BAsh_CntLgn wrote:

Theres one that does bit copying whose inner loop is unrolled. It contains 2 methods, one copies the other zeros. They’re both static and they’re the only two in there so I assume the class itself hasn’t been modified.

Read full topic

I’m thinking of one class in particular, but I’ve forgotten what you named it.

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

Well yea I understand that they do it to throw us off and not be able to cheat easily, but I’m not looking to make a bot here. This post was made in relation to White Castle’s post about a new server for the 481 client which I have been/am going through atm refactoring some things.

Read full topic

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

henry:

I meant are there any classes that are never actually called on or are pointlessly called on like how some methods are method4324(Byte byte0) and the byte is used in the method as if(byte0 == 0) {} when it is always called as method4324(0). This is a made up method btw… just an example.

you do realise jagex can invoke these methods, and also, they change method argument datatypes so you cant call it from your program. e.g. getClient().methodXXX(xxx) (easily).

Read full topic

item.title: In the new client
item.dc:creator: @henry henry
item.description:
@henry wrote:

…Its purpose is to through us off

I figure all the classes do have a purpose though. The obfuscater probably only through stuff into the classes and not generate new ones… Well I’m assuming they had an obfuscater or something add all the extras in because I don’t think somebody would go through it themselves putting all of those in.

Read full topic
